channel.title: Windows XP Account help
channel.description: Hi, I created a new account on my mom's laptop, as I am using it for a little while. Her account is the default administrator account, and mine is another administrator. However, I turned on the computer and found that it had shut off, and that her account was there. It now no longer appears in the user account settings from control panel, but the Administrator account does appear under "Computer Management" from the administrative tools. Can anyone help me get it back? Thanks, Justis Also, sorry if my typing is bad, my eyes are dilated.

item.title: Windows XP Account help
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“PR4Y, post:7, topic:201876”]i’ve had this problem a bunch, it seems to happen mainly when coming out of standby / hibernate.

when this happens, at the welcome screen… hit CTRL ALT DEL twice and it will bring up the alternate login screen which you may TYPE IN your username and password. i always recommend using this login screen as opposed to “Fast user switching” as that shit tends to be buggy and annoying.[/quote]
Didn’t see that, but thanks for the ideas. I’ll re-enable that.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows XP Account help
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Change the way you log in, It doesnt show the mian administrator account on the welcome screen log in. But you can log in as administrator if you change to the old style.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows XP Account help
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

It’s the first I’ve heard of such problems, but yes, good thinking - I didn’t think of the alternate login screen.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows XP Account help
item.dc:creator: @PR4Y PR4Y
item.description:
@PR4Y wrote:

i’ve had this problem a bunch, it seems to happen mainly when coming out of standby / hibernate.

when this happens, at the welcome screen… hit CTRL ALT DEL twice and it will bring up the alternate login screen which you may TYPE IN your username and password. i always recommend using this login screen as opposed to “Fast user switching” as that shit tends to be buggy and annoying.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows XP Account help
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

If you go into accessories in the startmenu, there is a files and settings transfer wizard

Never used it myself, not sure if that’s what you need.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows XP Account help
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:4, topic:201876”]That’s quite weird… If she had nothing on it just make her a new one

Otherwise go to document and settings, check and make sure all the user files are still there.

In the mean time, I’ll go have a look in account settings and see anything strikes me as having been what’s caused it.[/quote]
I checked the documents, and they are all there. I had this problem once before on a different computer, but I just recovered the computer and stayed with her account. Is there a way I can copy her account files and settings and make it into a new account?

Read full topic

item.title: Windows XP Account help
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

That’s quite weird… If she had nothing on it just make her a new one

Otherwise go to document and settings, check and make sure all the user files are still there.

In the mean time, I’ll go have a look in account settings and see anything strikes me as having been what’s caused it.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows XP Account help
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Sorry, what I meant is that at the user login screen the Administrator [mom’s account] does not appear, only mine does, and I want to get hers back on it too.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows XP Account help
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Log on in safemode and you can change pretty any admin settings you want. Although it’s kind of unclear exactly what you’re asking for help with?

Read full topic

item.title: Windows XP Account help
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Hi,
I created a new account on my mom’s laptop, as I am using it for a little while. Her account is the default administrator account, and mine is another administrator. However, I turned on the computer and found that it had shut off, and that her account was there. It now no longer appears in the user account settings from control panel, but the Administrator account does appear under “Computer Management” from the administrative tools. Can anyone help me get it back?
Thanks,
Justis
Also, sorry if my typing is bad, my eyes are dilated.

Read full topic
